resources.string: In order to proceed with your device upgrade you must decrypt previously encrypted apps. Click continue to unlock your credential store and decrypt your apps. Once complete you will have the option to enable full device encryption.

"Search for content on your device and find more on the Web. Using the handwriting search feature, you can also search for symbols and solutions to formulas."

Search for a keyword and apply filters such as date, location, and content type for more refined results. For broader results, apply filters without searching for a keyword. Try applying filters one-by-one and see how this affects your search results.

Make calls, send messages, search the web, and more by handwriting memos

To open Action Memo, turn on air command and select Action Memo, or double tap the screen while pressing the pen button. Your handwritten text will be recognized and you can link actions to it (e.g., you can make calls, save contact info, send messages or emails, search the Web and maps, and add tasks to S Planner).

Hover the S Pen over the text input area, then tap the button indicated to use the handwriting pad. You can also write directly on the screen with your S Pen in some features/apps, such as the dialing keypad, Clock, alarm, and time selector.

"You can encrypt accounts, settings, downloaded applications and their data, media and other files. Once your device is encrypted, you will need to enter a PIN or password to decrypt it every time you turn it on.
Encryption takes an hour or more. Before you start, ensure that the battery is charged and keep the device plugged in until encryption is complete. Interrupting this process may lead to the loss of some or all of your data."
Charge battery to above 80% and try again.

"This function allows you to share files between NFC-capable devices by holding them close together. Android Beam will turn on Bluetooth on both devices and instantly pair them. For example, you can share Web page links, YouTube videos, contacts, and more.
Simply bring the devices together, back to back, then tap your screen. The application that is currently being used will determine what gets beamed."

When this feature is on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, contacts, and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what is beamed.

"Turn your phone into a portable Wi-Fi HotSpot so you can share your mobile data connection with other devices. To use your phone's HotSpot capability, you must have the Smartphone Mobile HotSpot service added to your rate plan. You can create an allowed device list and set the connection mode for allowed devices. To configure Smartphone Mobile HotSpot, tap on the Menu icon, and then tap \\Configure\\."

"Turn your phone into a portable Wi-Fi hotspot so you can share your mobile data connection with other devices such as a laptop computer, tablet, PS3, etc. To use your phone's hotspot capability, Mobile Hotspot feature is required. If you do not already have this feature added to your rate plan, please visit a local MetroPCS store or call 888-8metro8."

Use your device as a Mobile Hotspot to share Wi-Fi with up to %1$s devices. Manage access to your Mobile Hotspot by creating a list of allowed devices. This service requires a subscription to the applicable modem plan. Please make sure you have subscribed to the appropriate data plan prior to use. Call 888-944-9400 if you need assistance. This device does not store your fingerprint. It only saves the information necessary to recognize your fingerprint through a hardware-based protection mechanism. The information that is required to recognize your fingerprint cannot be sent outside of the device.

In order for fingerprint recognition to function, your fingerprint information needs to be registered and stored in your device. After registering, you have the option to use your fingerprint for the following functions:
Register your fingerprints to simplify and enhance your device security.

Safety assistance is intended to help users send quick notice of their approximate location and visual surroundings to the mobile device of an emergency contact chosen in advance. It is only for your convenience and is not intended as, nor should it be treated as, a substitute for emergency calls to the authorities.

The accuracy of the location information and timely delivery of Safety assistance data may be affected by your surroundings and the condition of your device and the device of your emergency contact. Unless otherwise expressly stated or legally required, Samsung disclaims any warranty that the Safety assistance function will work accurately, continuously or without any error. Please note that your emergency contact must be a working mobile phone and the device must be turned on and capable of accepting text messages.
